abstract: The drug maker won one of the more than 2,000 lawsuits it faces from plaintiffs claiming it inadequately warned of reports linking Levaquin to tendon ruptures.
snippet: The drug maker won one of the more than 2,000 lawsuits it faces from plaintiffs claiming it inadequately warned of reports linking Levaquin to tendon ruptures.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson on Friday won a significant lawsuit concerning whether it adequately alerted doctors to the risks in prescribing its popular antibiotic Levaquin.

headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Wins Suit Over Antibiotic’s Side Effects
headline.print_headline: Johnson & Johnson Wins Suit Over Antibiotic’s Side Effects

byline.original: By Reed Abelson and Natasha Singer
